page.title: 08THE LEAD MINES OF PRIDDY
page.content: Lead mining began in this area during Roman times. The Roman road that cuts across the area was built to transport the lead to Bath and to ports near Bristol and on the South Coast. Mining was also a major economic activity during the 19th century. Today, however there are only the remains of what was an important industry. Most of the buildings have gone but the spoils heaps and the pools used to wash the lead still remain. The last mine closed at the beginning of this century. The risk to health was unknown in those days but there is evidence to proove that many of the workers suffered because of the work they had to do.
